title: Jating
author: Jating
content: https://www.nasdaq.com/press-release/annual-changes-nasdaq-100-indexr-2024-12-13So it's official, Microstrategy will be joining the Nasdaq 100 index, effective Dec. 23.What do you think of  this news? Will it affect Bitcoin in terms of investors buying as well since MSTR is a pro-Bitcoin company?Will this exposure another positive news for Bitcoin itself?

comments.author: betswift
comments.body: Wouldn't say it would influence other companies to play around with BTC - after all, the news don't bring the BTC itself as the thing that brought the company there.As such - it's great news, but nothing that much for BTC itself. At least, that's how I view it.

comments.author: coreguard
comments.body: MicroStrategy joining the Nasdaq 100 is definitely a noteworthy event, and it could have positive implications for Bitcoin. As a company with a pro-Bitcoin stance and significant Bitcoin holdings, MSTR’s inclusion might lead more investors to look at Bitcoin as an asset class, especially since institutional investment is often driven by companies in major indexes like the Nasdaq 100. This added exposure could spark more buying interest in Bitcoin, particularly among those who are looking for indirect exposure through stocks like MicroStrategy.While the effect on Bitcoin directly might be gradual, the long-term narrative of institutional adoption and support for Bitcoin could receive a boost, reinforcing its legitimacy as a financial asset. Overall, it's a positive development for Bitcoin, even if the immediate impact on its price remains uncertain

comments.author: headingnorth
comments.body: Any newly listed company in the NASDAQ 100 will trigger inflows of capital from passive funds like Invesco QQQ and other index funds.  For example, the QQQ ETF automatically allocates investor funds to whatever companies are in the Nasdaq 100. The allocation amount depends on the company's weighting on the list, and the weighting goes by marketcap.In the case of MSTR, they will use these fresh inflows to buy more bitcoin, which of course will pump the price of bitcoin.MSTR will have a 0.5% weighting on the list which translates to about $2 billion in initial inflows.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: It is a big news when it comes to corporates holding Bitcoins and supports it. MicroStrategy's main business is providing enterprise-level business intelligence (BI) software and their revenue is not even a billion dollar in a year. On the other hand Nasdaq 100 is an index comprising top 100 non-financial companies. So you can easily do the math. MicroStrategy's main business isn't pushing them to become a part of Nasdaq 100. They are able to achieve this big milestone just because of their Bitcoin holdings. So it is indeed a big news. This shows how Bitcoin can change the fate of a company and move it towards a positive outcome. My fear is that many other companies may actively consider investing in Bitcoin after this success of MicroStrategy.
